intro: Bellevalia salah-eidii, commonly known as the Jordanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East, particularly Jordan. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring and produces white or pale purple flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
